abstracts.cdata!:
The Water Supply and Sanitation Sector
            Adjustment Loan (WASAL) supports the Government's
            comprehensive program of reforms in the water supply and
            sanitation sector.  The main objectives of this program are
            : a) to restore the availability of basic rural services; b)
            to improve planning and sustainability of investments; c) to
            improve control of costs and efficiency of pricing; d) to
            strengthen the protection of water resources and of the
            environment; and e) to restore the financial autonomy of the
            sector. To this effect, the program comprises the following
            : 1) a new institutional framework based on Government
            retrenchment through increased privatization and community
            management of rural facilities; 2) introduction of efficient
            pricing of urban water services and of full recovery of
            maintenance costs in rural areas; 3) establishment of
            regulations and controls on private extraction of
            groundwater and on disposal of domestic and industrial
            wastewater; and 4) implementation of a new financing
            strategy and restructuring of sector finances.
